title: Status app v0.13-RC5 fails to start on Ubuntu 20.04

labels.name: priority 0: blocker
labels.description: an issues that requires immediate attention and that causes the app to not work at all (e.g a crash)

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

```
./StatusIm-Desktop-v0.13.0-rc.5-ab85c6-x86_64.AppImage
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(193) nim_status_client
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(100) mainProc
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/constants.nim(78) ensureDirectories
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/os.nim(2552) createDir
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/os.nim(2522) existsOrCreateDir
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/os.nim(2495) rawCreateDir
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/includes/oserr.nim(95) raiseOSError
Error: unhandled exception: Read-only file system
Additional info: /tmp/.mount_StatusNGXgHc/usr/Status [OSError]
```

## Steps to reproduce

Just start the app

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0.13-RC5
- Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04
@jakubgs is there anything u can assist with?

That looks like a bug in the app to me. Fails for me too, but in a different way:
```
INFO [06-28|13:37:07.179] Status backend initialized               backend=geth version=0.158.1 commit=a46bf97bf IpfsGatewayURL=https://ipfs.status.im/
Warning: Cannot open file '/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/status-dev.svg', because: No such file or directory (:0, )
Warning: Cannot open file '/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/status-dev.svg', because: No such file or directory (:0, )
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.382+02:00 Version: git master ab85c6f27              topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:182
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.382+02:00 Commit: ab85c6f27                          topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:183
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.382+02:00 Current date:                              topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:184 currentDateTime=2023-06-28T13:37:07+02:00
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.382+02:00 starting application controller...         topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:186
DBG 2023-06-28 13:37:07.382+02:00 init keycard using                         topics="keycard-service" tid=2 file=service.nim:83 pairingsJson=/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/Status/data/keycard/pairings.json
DBG 2023-06-28 13:37:07.383+02:00 initialization response:                   topics="keycard-service" tid=2 file=service.nim:86 initResp=ok
Warning: QQmlApplicationEngine failed to load component (:0, )
Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": '/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so' is not an ELF object (qrc:/main.qml:18, )
Failed to load translation file /home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/bin/i18n/qml_en.qm
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.496+02:00 starting application...                    topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:189
WRN 2023-06-28 13:37:07.499+02:00 Error decoding signal                      topics="signals-manager" tid=2 file=signals_manager.nim:48 err="Unknown signal received: mediaserver.started"
Warning: Error while loading QML: QUrl("qrc:/main.qml") (:0, )
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.499+02:00 shutting down...                           topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:157
INF 2023-06-28 13:37:07.499+02:00 logging out...                             topics="app-controller" tid=2 file=app_controller.nim:284
Traceback (most recent call last)
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(193) nim_status_client
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(166) mainProc
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/app/boot/app_controller.nim(285) delete
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/app_service/service/general/service.nim(43) logout
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/backend/general.nim(27) logout
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nim-status-go/status_go.nim(143) logout
SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)
```
oh okay! @jrainville @alexjba could u guys give it a try?

@anastasiyaig I can only try on macOS.

Looks like an import issue.
```
Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": '/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so' is not an ELF object (qrc:/main.qml:18, )
```
'/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage ' looks suspicious @jakubgs

Well yeah, I use [`appimage-run`](https://nixos.wiki/wiki/Appimage) on NixOS because otherwise it wouldn't work:

But that's irrelevant, you're focusing on the wrong thing. That's just a warning, as you can see at the beginning of the line.

The actual error is the crash:
```
Traceback (most recent call last)
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(193) nim_status_client
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(166) mainProc
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/app/boot/app_controller.nim(285) delete
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/app_service/service/general/service.nim(43) logout
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/backend/general.nim(27) logout
/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nim-status-go/status_go.nim(143) logout
SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)
```

Although to be fair this is also an error:
```
Warning: Error while loading QML: QUrl("qrc:/main.qml") (:0, )
```

> Although to be fair this is also an error:
> 
> ```
> Warning: Error while loading QML: QUrl("qrc:/main.qml") (:0, )
> ```

True, QML is basically saying Warning, the app is crashing. ðŸ˜„
It seems it can't link to StatusQ

@IvanBelyakoff Do you have the same QML error?
The stack trace is quite different..

> > Although to be fair this is also an error:
> > ```
> > Warning: Error while loading QML: QUrl("qrc:/main.qml") (:0, )
> > ```
> 
> True, QML qml is basically saying Warning, the app is crashing. smile It seems it can't link to StatusQ

Strictly speaking, it doesn't link to it - it fails loading it from QML; and this is the culprit:
```
Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": '/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so' is not an ELF object (qrc:/main.qml:18, )
```

Right, but if I start an older RC2 it works fine:
```
 > appimage-run StatusIm-Desktop-v0.13.0-rc.2-9d8f8c-x86_64.AppImage    
StatusIm-Desktop-v0.13.0-rc.2-9d8f8c-x86_64.AppImage installed in /home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/a9e9ec7a88d5f5e203e1a7570a2ccc49bee70cfcd8d9b59246919aef4d81bd50
INFO [06-28|14:13:24.721] Status backend initialized               backend=geth version=0.158.1 commit=a46bf97bf IpfsGatewayURL=https://ipfs.status.im/
INF 2023-06-28 14:13:24.915+02:00 Version: 0.13.0-rc.2                       topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:182
INF 2023-06-28 14:13:24.915+02:00 Commit: 9d8f8c5c9                          topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:183
INF 2023-06-28 14:13:24.915+02:00 Current date:                              topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:184 currentDateTime=2023-06-28T14:13:24+02:00
INF 2023-06-28 14:13:24.915+02:00 starting application controller...         topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:186
Critical: 
ERROR: No native SystemTrayIcon implementation available.
Qt Labs Platform requires Qt Widgets on this setup.
Add 'QT += widgets' to .pro and create QApplication in main().
 (:0, )
Critical: 
ERROR: No native Menu implementation available.
Qt Labs Platform requires Qt Widgets on this setup.
Add 'QT += widgets' to .pro and create QApplication in main().
 (:0, )
INF 2023-06-28 14:13:46.315+02:00 starting application...                    topics="status-app" tid=2 file=nim_status_client.nim:189
...
```

> @IvanBelyakoff Do you have the same QML error? The stack trace is quite different..

Nope, I have a different one. With RC2 I had that StatusQ not loading issue, but now it is different with RC5

@jakubgs Could it be related to https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11128?

#11128 Error: 
```
Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": Cannot load library /tmp/.mount_StatusewN8e2/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so: (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.29' not found (required by /tmp/.mount_StatusewN8e2/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so)) (qrc:/main.qml:18, )
```

Current Error on your machine: 
```
Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": '/home/jakubgs/.cache/appimage-run/b83951061806c3b816a10004a307fab37208f40fd3385f1b305d1dc838da492d/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so' is not an ELF object (qrc:/main.qml:18, )
```
But we already rolled back GCC 11 usage in that issue.
I have the same trace stack as Ivan, with nothing useful

> But we already rolled back GCC 11 usage in that issue.

It seems like https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11159 was only merged in master. I'll cherry-pick on release too
Cherry-pick: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11304

So the release branch is just outdated?

![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/2212681/76b3c650-2c38-4eae-bc00-5ecfd4cb6017)

> Cherry-pick: #11304

It's fixing this issue?

The initial stack reported here is quite different.
I'm not sure. Maybe? It's better to have the same in the release at least.

> It's better to have the same in the release at least.

No doubt ðŸ˜„ I was just wondering if this task can be closed.
We're trying to have a Linux build from the Release pipeline. We'll see then
I just got a build with the cherry-pick and sadly the issue isn't fixed. I get the same (bad) stack trace

I just tested a master PR build and it has the same issue.

I'll try to do a local build to see if it works
Local build from the `release/0.13.x` branch and it works fine. I'll check master but it should be the same
Local master build also works fine. So the issue is in the hosts or the Jenkinsfile.
local build is fine , autotests were running against rc5 and even passed. something is off with ci artifact

> local build is fine , autotests were running against rc5 and even passed. something is off with ci artifact

just to clarify, I meant that locally built release packages work (using `linux-build.sh`)
